title: Thai-flavoured chickpea and millet cakes with red pepper sauce
time: Hands on time 15 minutes, cooking time 45 minutes
description: Golden, crispy and bursting with Thai flavours – Rose Elliot’s recipe for chickpea and millet cakes is the easy vegetarian dinner you’ll come back to again and again.
ingredients: 3-4 tsp red Thai curry paste to taste
3 tbsp brown rice syrup (from health food shops) or maple syrup

method.Step 1: Put the millet into a medium pan with 300ml water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, then cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes until all the water has been absorbed and the millet is light and fluffy.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, make the red pepper sauce. Put the pepper into a saucepan with the 1 tbsp maple syrup, vinegar and chilli flakes to taste. Cover and cook over a gentle heat for 10-15 minutes until the pepper is very tender. (There’s no need to add water – the pepper soon produces enough.) Remove from the heat and set aside.

method.Step 3: In a mixing bowl, mash the cooked millet with the chickpeas, then mix in the Thai curry paste, coriander and spring onions. Season to taste. Form the mixture into 8 flat cakes, then coat in the flour.

method.Step 4: Heat about ½ cm rapeseed oil in a frying pan. Add the cakes and fry on both sides until golden, crisp and heated through.

method.Step 5: While the cakes are frying, make the mustard dip. In a small bowl, mix together the brown rice syrup/maple syrup, mustard and chilli flakes to taste.

method.Step 6: Blot the cooked cakes on kitchen paper, then serve with the mustard dip and the red pepper sauce.
